text: Updated travel information for all countries is available at regjeringen.no/reiseinformasjon.
Internal border control is continued
During the next week, all primary and secondary schools will be open to all levels.
Thanks to our joint efforts since March, we have got the spread of infection under control. Therefore, over time, we can ease the strict measures.
The companies and activities must operate in a professionally sound manner when they reopen.
The recommended size of groups in private contexts is increased from five to a maximum of 20 people, provided that you can keep at least one meter distance.
This also means that training and other organized sports activities can be carried out for up to 20 people who keep at least one meter distance.
This applies to all types of events, including sporting events such as conventions, cups and matches.
Travel abroad is still discouraged.
People who have been abroad must be quarantined when returning home.
The quarantine obligation changes from 14 to 10 days
You must still be quarantined if you have been in contact with infected people with a distance of less than two meters for more than 15 minutes.
Korona guide for public transport
A guide for infection control on buses, trains, trams, passenger boats, ferries and other public transport is now ready.
This special law does not entail a tightening of the rules and councils from 15 May. The bill only provides a new legal basis for continuing regulations that place restrictions on access to Norway.
Local rules must not hinder societal functions
Several municipalities have introduced local quarantine rules to prevent the spread of the coronavirus
I have therefore, through the Norwegian Directorate of Health, requested that the county governors assist the municipalities in this work, says Minister of Health and Care Services Bent Høie.
Tromsø municipality has adopted the quarantine for visitors from Oslo, Agder, Rogaland, Viken, Vestfold and Telemark, Innlandet and Vestland.
The Communicable Diseases Act gives municipalities the right to make decisions to protect the population, but the law requires that the measures must be in proportion to what their goal is.
The county governors will guide the municipalities in how to take care of important societal needs when formulating local rules, and if necessary assess the legality of the municipal decisions.
Among other things, there will no longer be a condition that the individual EEA employee is employed in an industry where there is a critical need for labor.

. Until now, there has been a general entry quarantine for people coming from the mainland. A working committee in Svalbard has prepared an industry standard for how tourism should be able to operate infection control.
Even though the Ministry of Foreign Affairs from 15 July makes exceptions from the travel council for the countries that FHI recommends, it is not an invitation to travel.

g) EEA citizens with such a family connection as mentioned in letter b, who are to visit a family member residing in Norway. Exceptions are made from the condition in the Immigration Act §110 third paragraph letter c that a relative in the descending line must be under 21 years of age.
From 1 July, it will be possible for all third-country nationals who have been granted a residence permit in accordance with the rules on labor immigration to enter Norway
The Ministry of Foreign Affairs advises against all travel that is not strictly necessary to all countries
When kindergartens and certain grade levels are now to gradually reopen, it is important to ensure that this is done in a responsible manner.
Out in the public space, people should be at least a meter away from other people.
